Description: The Minor in Financial Management, offered by the Undergraduate Tepper School of Business, develops students’ skills in financial analysis, valuation, and quantitative decision-making. Core courses cover corporate finance and financial modeling, as well as probability and statistics for business applications, complemented by foundational economics or data reasoning. Through a selection of advanced electives—from international finance and investment analysis to financial statement analysis, corporate finance, macroeconomics, blockchain business, and mathematical finance—students tailor their studies to emerging sectors and global markets. Emphasizing hands-on modeling, data-driven insights, and strategic problem-solving, this minor prepares graduates for careers in banking, consulting, asset management, fintech, and corporate strategy. Only one minor course may overlap with other major or minor requirements, and students must complete all required courses plus three electives from the list.
Required Couses: 70-391    Finance    and 70-493    Valuation and Financial Modeling and 70-207    Probability and Statistics for Business Applications and (36-200    Reasoning with Data or 36-220    Engineering Statistics and Quality Control or 36-218    Probability Theory for Computer Scientists or 36-225    Introduction to Probability Theory)
Elective Requirement: 70-398    International Finance    and/or and/or 70-428    Financial Statement Analysis and/or 70-492    Investment Analysis and/or 70-495    Corporate Finance and/or 73-103    Principles of Macroeconomics and/or 73-337    Business of Blockchain and/or 21-270    Introduction to Mathematical Finance
Transfer Credit: While there are no double counting restrictions between the minor and the student's home college general education requirements, only one minor course may double-count with any other major or minor requirements.
Notes: Students must take three electives from the elective requirement course list, and also satisfy all the required courses in the required course list.
